member.name: T:System.ScriptLoader
member.summary: Enables dynamic loading of a set of scripts references.

member.name: M:System.ScriptLoader.#ctor(System.String[])
member.summary: Initializes an instance of a script loader with a set of script references. Each reference is treated as the URL of the script, and is loaded into the current document.
member.param: The set of script references to load.

member.name: M:System.ScriptLoader.Dispose
member.summary: Disposes the ScriptLoader instance.

member.name: M:System.ScriptLoader.Load(System.Boolean,System.Int32,System.EventHandler,System.EventHandler)
member.summary: Starts the loading process. The specified callback is called upon completition of the loading process.
member.param: Whether the scripts should be loaded in parallel.
The number of milliseconds to allow the scripts to load before timing out.
The callback to invoke upon loading of scripts.
The callback to invoke upon error loading scripts.

member.name: T:System.Script
member.summary: The Script class contains various methods that represent global methods present in the underlying script engine.

member.name: M:System.Script.Alert(System.String)
member.summary: Displays a message box containing the specified message text.
member.param: The text of the message.

member.name: M:System.Script.Alert(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Displays a message box containing the specified value converted into a string.
member.param: The boolean to display.

member.name: M:System.Script.Alert(System.DateTime)
member.summary: Displays a message box containing the specified value converted into a string.
member.param: The date to display.

member.name: M:System.Script.Alert(System.Number)
member.summary: Displays a message box containing the specified value converted into a string.
member.param: The number to display.

member.name: M:System.Script.Confirm(System.String)
member.summary: Prompts the user with a yes/no question.
member.param: The text of the question.
member.returns: true if the user chooses yes; false otherwise.

member.name: M:System.Script.Eval(System.String)
member.summary: Enables you to evaluate (or execute) an arbitrary script literal. This includes JSON literals, where the return value is the deserialized object graph.
member.param: The script to be evaluated.
member.returns: The result of the evaluation.

member.name: M:System.Script.IsNull(System.Object)
member.summary: Checks if the specified object is null.
member.param: The object to test against null.
member.returns: true if the object is null; false otherwise.

member.name: M:System.Script.IsNullOrUndefined(System.Object)
member.summary: Checks if the specified object is null or undefined. The object passed in should be a local variable, and not a member of a class (to avoid potential script warnings).
member.param: The object to test against null or undefined.
member.returns: true if the object is null or undefined; false otherwise.

member.name: M:System.Script.IsUndefined(System.Object)
member.summary: Checks if the specified object is undefined. The object passed in should be a local variable, and not a member of a class (to avoid potential script warnings).
member.param: The object to test against undefined.
member.returns: true if the object is undefined; false otherwise.

member.name: M:System.Script.Literal(System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Enables you to generate an arbitrary (literal) script expression. The script can contain simple String.Format style tokens (such as {0}, {1}, ...) to be replaced with the specified arguments.
member.param: The script expression to be evaluated.
Optional arguments matching tokens in the script.
member.returns: The result of the script expression.

member.name: M:System.Script.Prompt(System.String)
member.summary: Prompts the user to enter a value.
member.param: The text of the prompt.
member.returns: The value entered by the user.

member.name: M:System.Script.Prompt(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Prompts the user to enter a value, along with providing a default value.
member.param: The text of the prompt.
The default value for the prompt.
member.returns: The value entered by the user.

member.summary: The color of the top border of the object.

member.name: P:System.DHTML.Style.Bottom
member.summary: The bottom position of the object in relation to the bottom of the next positioned object.

member.name: P:System.DHTML.Style.Clear
member.summary: Whether the object allows floating objects on its left side, right side, or both, so that the next text displays past the floating objects.

member.name: P:System.DHTML.Style.Clip
member.summary: Which part of a positioned object is visible.

member.name: P:System.DHTML.Style.Color
member.summary: The color of the text of the object.

member.name: P:System.DHTML.Style.CssText
member.summary: The persisted representation of this style.

member.name: P:System.DHTML.Style.Cursor
member.summary: The type of cursor to display as the mouse pointer moves over the object.

member.name: P:System.DHTML.Style.Direction
member.summary: The reading order of content within the object.

member.name: P:System.DHTML.Style.Display

member.name: P:System.DHTML.Style.Filter
member.summary: The collection of filters applied to an object. (Specific to Internet Explorer)

member.name: P:System.DHTML.Style.Font
member.summary: The font properties of the object or one or more of six user-preference fonts.

member.summary: The position of the object relative to the right edge of the next positioned object in the document hierarchy.

member.summary: The side of the object the text will flow.

member.summary: Whether the table layout is fixed.

member.summary: Whether The text in the object is left-aligned, right-aligned, centered, or justified.

member.summary: Indicates whether the text in the object has blink, line-through, overline, or underline decorations.

member.summary: Whether the object's text "blinks."

member.name: P:System.DHTML.Style.TextDecorationUnderline

member.summary: The indentation of the first line of text in the object.

member.summary: Indicates whether to render ellipses(...) to indicate text overflow.

member.summary: The rendering of the text in the object.

member.summary: The position of the object relative to the top of the next positioned object in the document hierarchy.

member.name: P:System.DHTML.Style.VerticalAlign

member.name: P:System.DHTML.Style.Visibility

member.summary: The stacking order of positioned objects.

member.name: P:System.DHTML.Style.Zoom
member.summary: The magnification scale of the object.

member.name: T:System.NonScriptableAttribute
member.summary: This attribute can be placed on types in system script assemblies that should not be imported. It is only meant to be used within sscorlib.dll.

member.name: T:System.ImportedAttribute
member.summary: This attribute can be placed on types that should not be emitted into generated script, as they represent existing script or native types.

member.name: T:System.RecordAttribute
member.summary: This attribute can be placed on types that should be emitted as light-weight types into the generated script. Light-weight types only have an optional constructor and no other members besides public fields. As such they are ideal for representing JSON data.

member.name: T:System.ResourcesAttribute
member.summary: This attribute can be placed on a static class that only contains static string fields representing a set of resource strings.

member.name: T:System.GlobalMethodsAttribute
member.summary: This attribute turns methods on a static class as global methods in the generated script. Note that the class must be static, and must contain only methods.

member.name: T:System.IntrinsicPropertyAttribute
member.summary: This attribute denotes a C# property that manifests like a field in the generated JavaScript (i.e. is not accessed via get/set methods). This is really meant only for use when defining OM corresponding to native objects exposed to script.

member.name: T:System.AttachedPropertyAttribute
member.summary: This attribute denotes a static method as an attached property accessor. The method must be of the form: Get/Set[PropertyName](object, value) and is converted into object[ClassType.PropertyName] = value. This is only for use for Silverlight types.

member.name: T:System.NamedValuesAttribute
member.summary: This attribute marks an enumeration type within a system assembly as as a set of names. Rather than the specific value, the name of the enumeration field is used as a string.

member.name: T:System.NumericValuesAttribute
member.summary: This attribute marks an enumeration type within a system assembly as as a set of numeric values. Rather than the enum field, the value of the enumeration field is used as a literal.

member.name: T:System.IgnoreNamespaceAttribute
member.summary: This attribute indicates that the namespace of type within a system assembly should be ignored at script generation time. It is useful for creating namespaces for the purpose of c# code that don't exist at runtime.

member.name: T:System.PreserveCaseAttribute
member.summary: This attribute allows suppressing the default behavior of converting member names to camel-cased equivalents in the generated JavaScript.

member.name: T:System.PreserveNameAttribute
member.summary: This attribute allows suppressing the default behavior of minimizing private type names and member names in the generated JavaScript.

member.name: T:System.ScriptAliasAttribute
member.summary: This attribute allows specifying a script name for an imported method. The method is interpreted as a global method. As a result it this attribute only applies to static methods.

member.name: T:System.AlternateSignatureAttribute
member.summary: This attribute allows defining an alternate method signature that is not generated into script, but can be used for defining overloads to enable optional parameter semantics for a method. It must be applied on a method defined as extern, since an alternate signature method does not contain an actual method body.

member.name: T:System.BrowsableAttribute
member.summary: This attribute marks a field, property, event or method as "browsable", i.e. present in the type descriptor associated with the type.

member.name: T:System.UInt64
member.summary: The ulong data type which is mapped to the Number type in Javascript.

member.name: M:System.UInt64.ToString(System.Int32)
member.summary: Converts the value to its string representation.
member.param: The radix used in the conversion (eg. 10 for decimal, 16 for hexadecimal)
member.returns: The string representation of the value.

member.name: T:System.Int32
member.summary: The int data type which is mapped to the Number type in Javascript.

member.name: M:System.Int32.ToString(System.Int32)
member.summary: Converts the value to its string representation.
member.param: The radix used in the conversion (eg. 10 for decimal, 16 for hexadecimal)
member.returns: The string representation of the value.

member.name: T:System.Char
member.summary: The char data type which is mapped to the String type in Javascript.
